com.mansoor.uncommon.configuration.Convertors
Interface Converter<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
DateConverter, DoubleConverter, FileConverter, FloatConverter, IntegerConverter, LongConverter, StringConverter, SymmetricKeyConverter, URIConverter, X509CertConverter
public interface Converter<T>

The Converter interface defines methods to transform a raw String value to generic value T and vice versa. All Configuration implementations are responsible for calling appropriate converter for a given type. A Configuration can be configured to use a Converter by adding it to Configuration's ConverterRegistry

For example this is how a programmer will add a FloatConverter to YamlConfiguration 

         Configuration configuration = new YamlConfiguration();
         configuration.getConverterRegistry().addConverter(Float.class, new FloatConverter());

Since:
0.1
Author:
Muhammad Ashraf

Method Detail

convert

T convert(String input)
Converts a String value to type T. This method is called immediately after a property value is read from a configuration.

Parameters:
input - value to be converted
Returns:
converted value

toString

String toString(T input)
Converts type T to String. This method is called before setting the value to a configuration.

Parameters:
input - input to be converted
Returns:
String
